p.s: The author used negatively connoted words in line one as a comparison to the national view on speaking foreign languages, can't won't, don't.
These words make it appear worse than before.
In line four, he used an adjective to show his personal opinion and to show that the development is bad sadly.
It shows that the news of the declining number of foreign languages studied at university level were not taken as seriously as they should have been and that that is a bad development.

Furthermore he uses arguments of the other side to strengthen his own line of arguments, for example in line six to eight While there is... has also stalled, which also weakens the other side of arguments.

In addition to that, he also gives examples of situations in which you do not have to know languages other than englishEnglish Perfectly intelligent people... intercultural telepathy anyway, but denysdenies their validity, he lists counter arguments in the following lines (ll. 16-18) language learning... and national security.

Furthermore, he lists of facts and comments on it in order to convince the reader of his opinion in lines 19 to 23 The most recent...and expect that to grow..., it makes the amount of UK businesses that require foreign language skills seem larger.
The author does it again in lines 24-26 The only reall good...more should, here he makes the number of students taking a langauge alonsidealongside another degree subject seem smaller.

In the following three lines, he gives example of the advantages someone has who studied a language alongside another degree subject a lawyer with Chinese language skills is more in demand than a pure lawyer or a pure linguist.
In lines 30 to 31, he used to straties to strengthen his message: he says There is no doubt, which makes it seem like a fact.
He brings up his point more of our young people and negates the opposite not fewer.
In line 32, he addresses the parents of the UK and includes himself and I'm one, he also uses inclusive pronouns in the following lines (l. 32-35) wem in line 33, our in line 34 and us in line 35.
All of the including himself to the addressed creates a feeling of unity among the readers and addressed, in the context it also strengthens the line of arguments.
to conclude, you can say that John Worne used the language to support his argumentation, even creating an emotional feeling sadly (l. 4).
His validity is based on facts and supported by communicative strategies and his use of language.
